# Parse duration: separate minutes for movies and seasons for TV Shows
def parse_duration(val):
    if pd.isna(val):
        return np.nan
    if 'Season' in val:
        return int(val.split(' ')[0])  # number of seasons
    else:
        return int(val.split(' ')[0])  # minutes

df['duration_num'] = df['duration'].apply(parse_duration)

print("\nDuration stats (numeric):")

```python
# Convert date_added to datetime and extract year/month
df['date_added_dt'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date_added'], format='%B %d, %Y', errors='coerce')
df['added_year'] = df['date_added_dt'].dt.year
df['added_month'] = df['date_added_dt'].dt.month

print("Date added year distribution (top 5):")
print(df['added_year'].value_counts().head())

# Top countries
print("\nTop 10 countries:")
print(df['country'].value_counts().head(10))

# Extract individual genres from listed_in (comma-separated)
def explode_genres(genres):
    if pd.isna(genres):
        return []
    return [g.strip() for g in genres.split(',')]

# Create a exploded series
genre_series = df['listed_in'].dropna().apply(explode_genres).explode()
print("\nTop 10 genres:")
print(genre_series.value_counts().head(10))

# Correlation between release_year and duration_num
corr = df[['release_year', 'duration_num']].corr()
print("\nCorrelation matrix:")
print(corr)

# Sample of rows with missing date_added
print("\nRows with missing date_added (sample):")
print(df[df['date_added'].isna()][['title','type','release_year']].head())
```
